mods.abstract: $100 Reward. RUNAWAY from the plantation of the undersigned, at Natchitoches, on or about the first of May last, a mulatto slave, named FRANK, aged about 33 or 34 years, speaks french and english, is about five feet, ten inches high, broad shouldered, weighs about 160 or 170 pounds, he has very little beard, is of bright yellow color, slightly lame from a fistula in the annus; he is a carpenter and a blacksmith, was purchased by the undersigned from the Estate of Mrs. Athanasse Lecour, near Cloutieville, Natchitoches Parish, Louisiana. The undersigned believes that the has left on horseback, as there being several missing in the neighborhood. He had some two or thee hundred dollars, in money, about him when he left. The undersigned suspects that he has stolen the horse from Mr. Lambre, said horse is a brown bay, of Canadian blood, is four years old, has a white star on the forehead, and a white hind foot. The undersigned will give one hundred dollars to any person who will bring him to his plantation, and if he should be taken in any jail, he will liberally pay the costs. ISAAC RACHAL. Natchitoches, November 4th, 1854. -4t

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Transformed into MODS from extended Dublin Core by the LDL Development Team at Louisiana State University.
